resources.string: Guidance and Counseling is a process designed to help you gain a greater understanding of yourself, address your concerns, and learn effective academic, behavioral, personal and interpersonal coping strategies. It involves a helping relationship between you and a counseling staff (registered guidance counselor or trained guidance associate) who has the desire and willingness to help you accomplish your individual goals.\nCounseling involves sharing personal information with your guidance counselor. During the course of counseling, there may be periods of anxiety or confusion. The outcome of counseling is often positive; however, the level of satisfaction for any individual is not predictable. The success of the counseling goals is usually dependent on the participation of the client. Your counselor is available to support you throughout the counseling process. The termination of the counseling shall be after the goals are met, or if there is a need for a referral to other professionals, or the client expresses the intention to terminate such.\nAll interactions with Guidance and Counseling Services, including scheduling of appointments, content of your sessions, progress in counseling, standardized test results, and individual personal records are strictly confidential. No record of counseling is contained in any academic, disciplinary, administrative, personnel, or career placement file. You may request in writing that the guidance and counseling staff release specific information about your counseling to persons you designate.

Because counseling is based on a trusting relationship between the guidance counselor and the client, the former will keep information shared by the latter confidential, except in certain situations in which an ethical responsibility limits confidentiality.
● The guidance and counseling staff works as a team. Your guidance counselor may consult with other counseling staff and allied professionals to provide the best possible care. These consultations are for professional and training purposes only.
● If there is evidence of clear and imminent danger of harm and abuse to self and /or from others, a guidance counselor is legally required to report this information to the authorities responsible for ensuring safety.
● A court order, issued by a judge, may require the Guidance and Counseling Services staff to release information contained in your record.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR STI TARLAC GUIDANCE APP
By using the STI Tarlac Guidance App, you agree to the following terms and conditions:
1. ACCEPTANCE OF TERMS
By creating an account and using this application, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions.
2. APP PURPOSE AND SERVICES
This application provides the following services to STI Tarlac students:
• Guidance and Counseling Appointments • Daily Mood Tracking and Emotional Assessment • Private Journal and Personal Reflection Tools • Career Planning and Academic Guidance • Personal Inventory and Assessment Forms • Referral Services to Professional Counselors • Exit Interview Management • Profile and Settings Management
3. USER ACCOUNT AND REGISTRATION
• You must provide accurate and complete information during registration • You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials • You must notify the guidance office immediately of any unauthorized use of your account • Only current STI Tarlac students are eligible to use this application
4. PRIVACY AND CONFIDENTIALITY
• All personal information and data shared through this app is strictly confidential • Your counseling sessions, journal entries, and personal assessments are protected • Information may only be shared with authorized guidance counselors and staff • Data may be used for academic and counseling purposes only • We comply with applicable privacy laws and regulations
5. DATA COLLECTION AND USAGE
The app collects the following types of data:
• Personal information (name, student number, contact details) • Academic information (program, year level) • Emotional and psychological assessments • Journal entries and personal reflections • Appointment scheduling and counseling records • Career planning and inventory responses
6. USER RESPONSIBILITIES
• Use the app only for legitimate educational and counseling purposes • Provide honest and accurate information in all forms and assessments • Respect the confidentiality of other users\' information • Report any technical issues or concerns to the guidance office • Maintain appropriate and respectful communication
7. PROHIBITED ACTIVITIES
You may not:
• Share your account credentials with others • Attempt to access other users\' accounts or data • Use the app for any illegal or unauthorized purposes • Submit false or misleading information • Interfere with the app\'s functionality or security
8. MOOD TRACKER SPECIFIC TERMS
• Daily mood tracking is voluntary but encouraged for better counseling support • Mood data is used to provide personalized guidance and support • A 24-hour cooldown period applies between mood tracking sessions • Mood data is confidential and used only by authorized guidance staff
9. JOURNAL AND PRIVACY
• Private journal entries are encrypted and stored securely • Journal content is accessible only to you and authorized guidance counselors • Entries may be discussed during counseling sessions with your consent • You can edit or delete your journal entries at any time
10. APPOINTMENT SCHEDULING
• Appointments are subject to counselor availability • Cancellations should be made at least 24 hours in advance • No-show policies may apply as per guidance office procedures • Emergency situations may require immediate counselor contact
11. DATA RETENTION AND DELETION
• Your data will be retained for the duration of your enrollment at STI Tarlac • Upon graduation or withdrawal, data retention policies will apply • You may request data deletion subject to legal and administrative requirements • Some data may be retained for statistical and research purposes (anonymized)
12. TECHNICAL SUPPORT AND AVAILABILITY
• The app is provided "as is" without warranties • Technical support is available during regular office hours • The app may experience downtime for maintenance or updates • We strive to maintain 99% uptime but cannot guarantee uninterrupted service
13. MODIFICATIONS TO TERMS
• These terms may be updated periodically • Users will be notified of significant changes • Continued use of the app constitutes acceptance of modified terms • Previous versions of terms are available upon request
14. TERMINATION
• Your access to the app may be terminated for violation of these terms • Termination does not affect the confidentiality of your data • You may request account deletion at any time • Data retention policies apply even after account termination
15. CONTACT INFORMATION

STI Tarlac Guidance Office Email: guidance@sti.edu.ph Phone: (045) 982-0115 Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
